bow: phantom crying does anyone else hear the phantom crying when my kid is sleeping during nap time especially find myself going to check at least every ten minutes because hear crying only to find baby soundly sleeping so creepy yes but in two separate circumstances the first time actually got my child down for nap in her crib kept jumping up because swore heard her crying nope just new mom nerves visiting my parents we all heard crying on the monitor she was sound asleep but the kid next door with an identical baby monitor was not switched the channel no more phantom baby hear crying and children voices when in the shower think it because anxious when in there expecting them to be fighting or getting in trouble honestly children drive moms insane sometimes months old and still hear phantom crying even hear my tot crying but realize it just background noise that my brain interpreted to be crying when shower ll hear this too ll be like oh nooo run out wet and neked because baby likes to put things in her face sound asleep all the time when can not see him of course yes the shower is the worse yep especially when get her back down after middle of the night feed there one spot on my kitchen floor that sounds bit like quiet cry when step on it so while washing my haakaa and feeding the cat hit it multiple times and freeze to listen every time every night still hear it and my kid is years old just not as often as when she was an infant yes when was floor nurse heard call lights bells in the shower too must be something about the shower yes also dream about her waking up and that have heard it and then fallen back asleep so that when actually wake up am riddled with guilt that have left her crying for hours when it only been matter of seconds come on brain you re supposed to be on my side oh yeah my husband will take them to the store and hear it my kids are and 10 haven been babies in this house in awhile yet still plagued yes and to make matters worse live next door to daycare so constantly wondering whether the sound hearing is from my baby next door or my imagination it fun yep its the lovely follow up to the post partum phantom kicks my kiddo is and still hear it especially after he down for the night and watching show with my husband surround sound throws me for loop my cat has also always sounded like my son swear he has changed the pitch of his whining as my son voice has developed my mom and my husband have also both been fooled my kids are and and swear can still hear baby crying when close my eyes yes lol yes it happens alot yuuuup even some strains of the white noise machine sound like crying now my daughter is six and still get this even when she not here sometimes swear hear her calling me seriously mom brain is the worst dreamed monitor stopped working and slept all night letting my baby go hungry woke up convinced starved her all night had been asleep an hour the monitor was fine she was sleeping soundly oh yeah there for the first months both my husband and heard the phantom cries it was the weirdest thing we had ever experienced wow really glad it not just me that hears phantom cries always hear them when step outside for smoke break and he passed out in his bassinet rush back inside and he still out like light here head scratcher heard phantom crying all the time with my first with my second when hear phantom crying *it still the first* hear my older one phantom cry not my younger one 🤷‍♀️ brains are weird if it makes you feel any better once my month old son was sleeping next to me on the couch while was folding laundry and he was making some cute sleep faces and all of sudden he cried really loud just for couple breaths and then went on sleeping soundly so you might not be entirely crazy except for all you people with grown kids you probably are ummm how about phantom poo smells was convinced that could smell dirty nappy but my daughter was in daycare and was in room full of adults only hear phantom crying falling injuries general commotion while in the shower my daughter is still hear random crying at night sometimes everyone is always sound asleep and reminiscent of the forever rocking back and forth like you re holding baby any time you have to stand still waiting in line chatting with someone my kids are and 18 months and still rock them both when holding them interesting mild sensory deprivation always attributed it to exhaustion while am always technically exhausted do always feel exhausted when in the shower definitely an interesting phenomenon omg yes few times ve turned the water off and stood silently listening oh nothing good just losing my mind back to shampooing it is now curious to google it more would only hear the beeping after shift if hadn worked didn hear it is due around halloween ll have to see if hear crying yes with both my kids it was weird little personal milestone when the phantom crying stopped sounding like my first child and started sounding like my second they re only 20 months apart so it never really went away in between them the shower is the worst especially if the fan is running but ve found the phantom crying is more common and more aggravating when already extra stressed on those days keep the video monitor on beside me so can look at them and see they really are crying and that helps or turn the sound monitor up loud enough that can hear their white noise machine and definitely no crying all the time my kid just turned three and still hear phantom cries from his room work ems and hear phantom calls all the time even if do have radio with me omg yes it like when have ringtone for too long and hear phantom rings phantom gwens everywhere push the shopping cart back and forth too like push the stroller to soothe the baby got ta love it was just explaining this to my hubby the other day it totally freaks me out yah kiddo is 18 months he spends the weekends with his dad even then hear his cries yells or even footsteps when in the shower especially it gets annoying because rush whenever doing something because so used to it maybe or the particular type of white noise it creates call it my silence of the lambs thing because in it clarisse says she can still hear the lambs crying years later if in the kitchen or something have to ask my husband if the baby was crying or if it was that from an evolutionary point of view it probably something mothers are wired to have to ensure they ll check on the offspring often thus giving them better chances of survival yes my baby is only days old but already hear phantom cries almost every time try to sleep my husband looked at me like was crazy when told him only had one instance of this that was clear as day was awake and could hear child crying and my son was asleep none of my other neighbors had kids so just laid there listening to this soft cry my daughter now likes to say it was her way of telling me she was ready to come out lol would drop my kid off at my moms then run errands would think he was in the backseat babbling at me look in my rearview see him not there and panic for half second where my kid oh wait mom house whew still wake up out of sound sleep looking for my daughter thinking shes crying when she is in fact in her crib in her room it happens whenever she is near me or she is in the house with me was outside recently and thought heard my daughter playing happily in her crib upon further investigation realized it was distant bird all the time especially when in the shower or when she down for nap and enjoying relaxation time and think hear her but nope oh goddd the phantom crying it the reason awake right now even though got no sleep hear it all night long and think the white noise machine makes it worse my husband and both get it pretty badly if we are out of hearing range too so we basically conduct all our activities ten feet from the bedroom door after she goes to sleep otherwise the conversation all night is just was that her back and forth every five minutes removed me too know that feeling wonder if it mild ptsd response from chronic need to run into unknown and potentially high demand situations maybe or the paranoia that you re going to miss call had seeped into your regular life mine is 12 and still think hear her crying or calling for me at night occasionally yep happens to me 13 weeks postpartum also wake up frequently and think am holding the baby in bed when not even trying to breastfeed sheets lol sounds about right not getting mentally clocked out did when my toddler almost years old now was younger had pretty bad postpartum anxiety you should google the symptoms and see if anything lines up with how you feel and if so talk to your doctor maybe that not what this is for you and this is just an odd one off thing going on but just in case it is here my story ve always had anxiety so that nothing new to me my anxiety is both generalized and social and after got over hump where it was pretty bad in my late teens it been pretty stable and at what would consider low to mid level not debilitating or anything ve had no issues holding jobs or having relationships this was different though was really worried about my baby especially when she was sleeping was scared of sids if she made funny noise in her sleep thought she was choking and would hear her crying when she was sleeping and or when was sleeping during normal waking hours though did feel fine aside from what consider to be my normal level of anxiety and none of my regular anxiety was focused on my baby the postpartum anxiety was only related to either of us sleeping do know why now have continued problems sleeping although no longer worry about her sleeping or sids and no longer hear her crying when she is am on medication for anxiety which was taking before got pregnant reduced my dose before pregnancy but was unable to go off it completely did go off second medication for anxiety completely before pregnancy did not increase my dose again after she was born or go back on the second med because knew be having another baby in few years and reducing my dose stopping the other med was so super hard did want to go through it again am now pregnant with our second and final baby and after he born ll ask about getting my dose increased back up to what it was before and starting the second medication again because felt like they both really helped all that being said think you should listen to your mother intuition if you think something is actually wrong and it reasonable to believe so do still think the choking noises my daughter made in her sleep during her first few months were not normal her pediatrician was pretty dismissive of it when brought it up probably partially because she had no other symptoms of anything being wrong and probably also partially because had postpartum anxiety although it not like was always in her office with list of concerns this was literally the only concern brought to her pediatrician got sleep solution for my daughter that made her sleeping surface inclined and that helped lot after she was or months old she no longer needed it and was able to sleep in normal crib if had been able to solve it on my own with the inclined sleeping position would have made recording of my daughter doing it and brought it to her ped and if her ped still dismissed me would have sought second opinion my kid is still hear phantom crying particularly when in the shower it crazy and the brain is weird every single night even if ds is out with dh hear it gets on dhs nerves bc always ask him if he hears it too absolutely wake up several times night to phantom crying it sounds so real for awhile was convinced there must be another baby in our building always have to strain my ears for second before confirm there actually no crying once realized what it was thought it would stop but several months on it just as real as ever auditory hallucinations absolutely guess it triggered by anxiety if expect my kid to wake up when reeeaaaallly do want her to all hear is her waking up try to just let the desire go so the anxiety and phantom sounds go with it every time shower or take bath ve heard it called an auditory hallucination it happens to almost everyone like even most non moms will think they hear the phone ring while they are vacuuming stuff like that cool wonder if it because you re being extra auditorally vigilant because your hearing is impaired by your environment because it seems like it always something urgent being hallucinated like kids crying alarms going off phones ringing not pleasant music or birds singing or babies laughing
